57 [Mathie ap.]
SEint Mathie Apostle is : ase &yogh;e schullen alle i-wite;
Þoru&yogh;h lot he was apostel i-maud : ase it is i-write.
Ivdas þat Apostel was : þo he hadde ore louerd i-sold,
Þare [nas][om.] non longue in is stude : þat Apostel were i-told.
Aftur þe tyme þat ore louerd : in-to heouene was i-sti&yogh;e,
Þe Apostles weren alle to-gadere : and ore lauedi seinte marie:
¶ So þat seinte peter heom radde : ase ore louerd hadde i-bede,
For Ivdas þat Apostle was : to nimen on in is stude.
So þat huy nomen and casten lot. : and ope seint Mathie it gan falle;
So þat he, and seint powel : þe laste weren of heom alle.—
Seint Mathie cam of hei&yogh;e Men : þat nouþe apostel is;
In þe londe of Bedlehem : i-bore he was, i-wis.
Seothþe, þo he Apostel was : and huy wenden alle wide
And precheden Men[overlined.] to cristindom : euerech in his side,
Into þe londe of Iudee : seint Mathie þene wei nam;
Þare he prechede to manie Men : and brou&yogh;hte to cristindom.
he helde also þat sike weren— : ne may no man rikeni alle;
Þoru&yogh;h him þat folk into cristindom : swiþe wide it gan falle.
¶ Þare was a maister in þat lond : þat a swuch drunch made þere
Þat alle þat þar-of dronken : anon-ri&yogh;ht a-blende were.
Of þat drunch men brou&yogh;ten to seint Mathie : and he it dronk anon:
And him nas þare-fore neuere þe worsse : ake al hol he gan forth gon.
Þat folk hadde þer-of wonder gret : þat he ne les anon is si&yogh;hte.
"Alas, mine leoue freond," quath seint Mathie : "&yogh;e ne seoth nou&yogh;t godes mi&yogh;hte.
Þat &yogh;e i-seon sothþliche godes mi&yogh;hte : þat he on us sende,
Latez bringue here bi-fore me alle þulke : þat þare-with weren a-blende!"
Men leten heom sechen wel widen out : and bringue þere into place.
Þis holie Man heo[m] helde a-non : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace;
¶ Þreo hundred men and mo[al. to (=two)] : þoru&yogh;h ore louerdes mi&yogh;hte
Þat þoru&yogh; þat drunch weren a-blende : he &yogh;af heom þare heore si&yogh;te.
Þat folk criede &yogh;eorne on him : and þicke a-bouten him cam,
And bilieueden on god þoru&yogh; is techingue : and turnden to cristin|dom.
¶ Þe luþer Iustise of þat lond : her-of heorde telle:
he liet nimen þis holie man : and in strongue deþe a-quelle.
Ake it nis nou&yogh;hwere in boke i-founde : &yogh;wat deth he hadde þere;
Ake i-martred he was in strong torment : ase alle þe apostles were.
¶ Guode Men comen aftur-ward : and þat holi bodi nome
And fram þe londe of Iudee : ladden it sethþe to Rome,
And bureden it þere with gret honour : þare ase men schewez &yogh;uyte
In seinte Marie churche ofte : his heued with grete pruyte.
Nov god for þe loue of seint Mathi : us leue ore lif so wisse
Þat we, &yogh;wanne we heonnes wiendeth : comen to heouene blisse.[MS. blissa] AmeN.
